subject: Education
title: The Hippocampus: Memory's Gatekeeper
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Hippocampus: Memory's Gatekeeper usable.

hook.text: A man named H.M. had his hippocampus removed and could never form a new memory again.

buildup.text: The hippocampus is a seahorse-shaped structure deep in the brain's temporal lobe.

discovery.text: It converts short-term memories into long-term ones through a process called consolidation.

twist.text: H.M. could still learn new motor skillsâ€”proving that different memories use different brain paths.

climax.text: London taxi drivers have larger hippocampi from memorizing thousands of city streets.

punchline.text: The brain grows to fit what you ask it to remember.

quiz.question: What role does the hippocampus play in memory?
options: It converts short-term memories into long-term ones through consolidation
It stores all visual memories permanently
It controls the emotional intensity of memories
